required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Comparison of Changes of QTc, Tp-e Interval, and Tp-e/QT Ratio, Tp-e/QTc Ratio on the ECG During Living Donor Liver Transplantation Under Desflurane and Total Intravenous Anesthesia -Randomized Controlled Trial
clinical_study.official_title: The Comparison of Changes of QTc, Tp-e Interval, and Tp-e/QT Ratio, Tp-e/QTc Ratio on the ECG During Living Donor Liver Transplantation Under Desflurane and Total Intravenous Anesthesia -Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock:
Prolonged corrected QT interval (QTc) has been observed in about half of patients with liver cirrhosis. Marked prolongation of QTc (ie, 500 msec) has been considered to be a risk factor for fatal ventricular arrhythmia, such as torsade de pointes,7,8 which has been reported in liver transplantation (LT) surgery. In a previous study, prolonged QTc interval ( 500 msec) was frequently observed throughout the procedure of LT, even among patients with baseline QTc 440 msec. Therefore, it is important to optimize electrolyte balance and hemodynamic status to reduce greater risk of perioperative arrhythmias.
The investigators hypothesized that the change of QTc interval might be differ according to method of general anesthesia (inhalation agent vs. intravenous agent).

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Arm 1: inhalation anesthesia (desflurane) group Arm 2: total intravenous anesthesia (propofol) group
study_design_info.masking_description: patients will be randomly allocated to 2 groups using computer-generated randomization method. Care provider will not be blinded to the group allocation, because anesthesiologists should be aware of the method of anesthesia.

primary_outcome.description: The investigator will assess the QTc interval 3 minutes after the reperfusion during liver transplantation.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of the surgery
secondary_outcome.description: The investigator will assess the QTc interval at the end of liver transplantation.

clinical_study.condition: Liver Cirrhosis(Who Will Undergo Planed Liver Transplantation)

arm_group.description: Anesthesia is induced and maintained with desflurane and sufentanil
Anesthesia is induced and maintained with propofol and sufentanil

intervention.description: Anesthesia is induced and maintained with desflurane and sufentanil
Anesthesia is induced and maintained with propofol and sufentanil

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with liver cirrhosis who will undergo planned liver transplantation
Exclusion Criteria:
- 1. emergent liver transplantation
- 2. unstable angina
- 3. recent MI(Myocardial Infarction)
- 4. uncontrolled hypertension (diastolic BP > 110mmHg)
- 5. implantable cardiac defibrillator
- 6. severe obesity (BMI>30kg/m2)
- 7. allergy to propofol

facility.name: Department of Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine, Anesthesia and Pain Research Institute, Yonsei University College of Medicine

patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data will become available when the script for this study is accepted in journal.
